snippet: Paul McLeod, the owner of the Graceland Too museum in Holly Springs, Miss., shot an intruder to death and then died two days later, apparently of natural causes.
abstract: Residents of Holly Springs, Miss, lament the sad demise of two locals, one peculiar and one down on his luck, after their paths crossed; Paul McLeod, eccentric proprietor of unofficial Elvis museum in his home, was found dead, apparently of natural causes, two days after fatally shooting troubled Dwight David Taylor, who seemingly forced his way in to McLeod's home; police had interviewed and released McLeod, but few expect any charges to be brought.
lead_paragraph: Paul McLeod, the owner of the Graceland Too museum in Holly Springs, Miss., shot an intruder to death and then died two days later, apparently of natural causes.

headline.main: Two Lives Collide, and End, at an Elvis Shrine
headline.print_headline: Two Lives Collide, and End, at an Elvis Shrine
